SEARCH
Package org.hrw.mapping

Class Converter

java.lang.Object
org.hrw.mapping.Converter
public class Converter extends Object
Converts raw monitoring data between different representations and the internal domain model (ServerRecord, VMRecord).

Supported conversions include:

  • XML (RRD updates) → ServerRecord
  • JDBC ResultSet → ServerRecord
  • JSON → ServerRecord
  • ServerRecord → CSV byte array

The converter uses a mapping file (e.g. map.csv) to translate raw legend names from the monitoring output into canonical column names used by the application and database.

  • Constructor Details

    • Converter

      public Converter(String path)

  • Method Details

    • xmlToServerRecord

      public List<ServerRecord> xmlToServerRecord(Document xmlDoc) throws XPathExpressionException
      Converts an XML document containing monitoring data into a list of ServerRecord objects.

      The method:

      1. extracts the data node and its rows,
      2. builds a legend list using the mapping file,
      3. maps each XML row to a ServerRecord,
      4. reverses the list so data is ordered chronologically.
      Parameters:
      xmlDoc - source XML document
      Returns:
      list of converted server records
      Throws:
      XPathExpressionException - if the XPath queries fail

    • resultSetToServerRecord

      public List<ServerRecord> resultSetToServerRecord(ResultSet resultSet) throws SQLException
      Converts a JDBC ResultSet into a list of ServerRecord objects.

      The method expects columns matching the flattened schema of ServerRecord and VMRecord (e.g. vm2_cpu_avg, ...).

      Parameters:
      resultSet - query result containing server metrics
      Returns:
      list of server records constructed from the result set
      Throws:
      SQLException - if column access fails

    • jsonToServerRecord

      public List<ServerRecord> jsonToServerRecord(String rawBody) throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
      Converts a JSON payload into a list of ServerRecord objects.

      The JSON is expected to contain a top-level data array, whose elements can be mapped directly to ServerRecord.

      Parameters:
      rawBody - JSON string containing the data array
      Returns:
      list of server records
      Throws:
      com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException - if parsing or mapping fails

    • serverRecordToCsv

      public byte[] serverRecordToCsv(List<ServerRecord> filteredData)
      Converts a list of ServerRecord objects into a CSV export.

      The first line contains the attribute names derived from ServerRecord.getAttributeNames(), followed by one line per record. Commas are replaced by semicolons to avoid issues with regional settings for csv files.

      Parameters:
      filteredData - list of records to export
      Returns:
      CSV content as UTF-8 encoded byte array
